headline.main: THE HIGH COST OF HOSPITALS' FAILURE TO SPOT AND TREAT ALCOHOLISM

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Robert Pear's excellent Jan. 25 news article, ''Costs of Health Care Increased 12.5 Percent in 1981,'' focused attention on a critical problem for all of us: 1981 saw the greatest increase in medical-care costs since 1935, the year the Federal Government began reporting them. The costs of hospital rooms soared 17 percent. he author reviewed a number of fa ctors that contributed to these startling cos t escalations, including the payments for hospital services and the manner in which these services are reimbursed to thehospitals.
